Class HUMANPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • CheckerPlayer
      • HUMANPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CheckerBoardConstants

    public class HUMANPlayer
extends CheckerPlayer
implements CheckerBoardConstants
    This class allows us to have a human player. Notice the calculate move method does nothing. The only function of this class is so that I can assign a CheckerPlayer and ask the question "Is this class an 'instanceof' HUMANPlayer?

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class CheckerPlayer

        chosenMove, playerName

      • Fields inherited from interface CheckerBoardConstants

        BLACK_KING, BLACK_KING_GRAY_BACKGROUND, BLACK_KING_WHITE_BACKGROUND, BLACK_PAWN, BLACK_PAWN_GRAY_BACKGROUND, BLACK_PAWN_WHITE_BACKGROUND, BLACK_PLAYER, BLANK, BLANK_GRAY_BACKGROUND, BLANK_WHITE_BACKGROUND, BOARD_HEIGHT, BOARD_PIXEL_HEIGHT, BOARD_PIXEL_WIDTH, BOARD_WIDTH, BORDER_SIZE, INVALID_MOVE, NEITHER_PLAYER, RED_KING, RED_KING_GRAY_BACKGROUND, RED_KING_WHITE_BACKGROUND, RED_PAWN, RED_PAWN_GRAY_BACKGROUND, RED_PAWN_WHITE_BACKGROUND, RED_PLAYER, SQUARE_HEIGHT, SQUARE_WIDTH, VALID_MOVE, VALID_MOVE_BUT_INCOMPLETE

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HUMANPlayer(java.lang.String name)

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calculateMove(int[][] boardState, int whosTurn)
      This method intentionally does nothing because the move is determined by how the human clicks the checkerboard.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HUMANPlayer

        public HUMANPlayer(java.lang.String name)
        This constructor allows you to create a human checker player.
        Parameters:
        name - This is the name you would like to give this checker player.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateMove

        public void calculateMove(int[][] boardState,
                          int whosTurn)
        This method intentionally does nothing because the move is determined by how the human clicks the checkerboard.
        Specified by:
        calculateMove in class CheckerPlayer
        Parameters:
        boardState - This is the state of the board for which you need to choose the next move.
        whosTurn - This indicates which player you need to choose a move for given the specified board state (RED_PLAYER or BLACK_PLAYER).
